content: The Colosseum, also known as the Flavian Amphitheatre, is an iconic symbol of Imperial Rome located in which country?

The Colosseum, also known as the Flavian Amphitheatre, is an iconic symbol of Imperial Rome located in Italy. It is situated in the heart of Rome, the capital city of Italy. This magnificent structure was built nearly 2,000 years ago and still stands today as a testament to the engineering prowess of the ancient Romans.
